00002  * Project: BaBar detector at the SLAC PEP-II B-factory

00016 #include <iostream>
00017 using namespace std;
00018 #include <math.h>
00019 #include "TMatrixD.h"
00020 #include "RooFitCore/RooFitResult.hh"
00021 #include "BToDKTo3piK/BdkOnResNLLYields.hh"

00027 //------------------------------------------
00028 BdkOnResNLLYields::BdkOnResNLLYields(BdkPdfOnRes & pdf, 
00029                                      double corrNsigAsym,
00030                                      int systBit) :
00031   _pdf(&pdf),
00032   _cpProxies(GetName()+TString(".cpProxies"),
00033              GetTitle()+TString(" cpProxies"), this)
00034 {
00035   SetName (TString(_pdf->GetName()) + ".NLLYields");
00036   SetTitle(TString(_pdf->GetTitle()) + ".NLLYields");
00037 
00038   // add all the dependents to the proxy list
00039   _cpProxies.add(_pdf->cpParams());
00040   _cpProxies.add(*_pdf->numEvt(BdkEvtTypes::SIG_GOOD_D));
00041   _cpProxies.add(*_pdf->typeAsym(BdkEvtTypes::SIG_GOOD_D));
00042                  
00043 
00044   // the expected yield PER CHARGE for no CP:
00045   _noCPNsig = 0.5 * pdf.nBB()->getVal() * BRBtoDK() * BRDto3piOverK2pi() * BRDtoK2pi() * efficiency();
00046 
00047   // the relative error on this expected yield is an incoherent sum
00048   // of the relative errors of the factors:
00049   _noCPNsigRelErr = 0;
00050 
00051   if (NBB & systBit) {
00052     _noCPNsigRelErr += nBBRelErr() * nBBRelErr();
00053   }
00054 
00055   if (BR3PIoverK2PI & systBit) {
00056     _noCPNsigRelErr += BRDto3piOverK2piRelErr() * BRDto3piOverK2piRelErr();
00057   }
00058 
00059   if (BRK2PI & systBit) {
00060     _noCPNsigRelErr += BRDtoK2piRelErr() * BRDtoK2piRelErr();
00061   }
00062 
00063   if (BRDK & systBit) {
00064     _noCPNsigRelErr += BRBtoDKRelErr() * BRBtoDKRelErr();
00065   }
00066 
00067   if (EFF & systBit) {
00068     _noCPNsigRelErr += efficiencyRelErr() * efficiencyRelErr();
00069   }
00070 
00071   _noCPNsigRelErr = sqrt(_noCPNsigRelErr);
00072 
00073   // Get parameters of the yields fit:
00074   RooRealVar* nsigVar= (RooRealVar *)(_pdf->numEvt(BdkEvtTypes::SIG_GOOD_D));
00075   RooRealVar* asymVar= (RooRealVar *)(_pdf->typeAsym(BdkEvtTypes::SIG_GOOD_D));
00076 
00077   _nsig = nsigVar->getVal();
00078   _asym = asymVar->getVal();
00079 
00080   // Use parabolic or average asymmetric errors for nSig and asym
00081   if (nsigVar->hasError()) _nsigErr = nsigVar->getError();
00082   else {
00083     cout << GetName() << ": Using average of asymmetric errors for "
00084          <<nsigVar->GetName() << endl;
00085     _nsigErr = (fabs(nsigVar->getAsymErrorLo())+fabs(nsigVar->getAsymErrorHi()))/2;
00086   }
00087 
00088   if (asymVar->hasError()) _asymErr = asymVar->getError();
00089   else {
00090     cout << GetName() << ": Using average of asymmetric errors for "
00091          <<asymVar->GetName() << endl;
00092     _asymErr = (fabs(asymVar->getAsymErrorLo())+fabs(asymVar->getAsymErrorHi()))/2;
00093   }
00094 
00095   // From the correlation matrix, we reconstruct the error matrix element:
00096   _errNsigAsym = corrNsigAsym * _asymErr * _nsigErr;
00097 
00098   // Make sure our value isn't cached but recalculated each time (it's cheap):
00099   setOperMode(RooAbsReal::ADirty);
00100 }
00101 
00102 //------------------------------------------
00103 BdkOnResNLLYields::~BdkOnResNLLYields() {
00104 }
00105 
00106 //------------------------------------------
00107 Double_t BdkOnResNLLYields::evaluate() const {
00108   // The error in the expected total yield comes from the relative
00109   // error on the nBB, etc. But these errors cancel in the expected asym:
00110   const double expectedNsigErr = expectedNsig() * _noCPNsigRelErr;
00111   const double expectedAsymErr = 0;
00112 
00113   // The observed yield, asymmetry, and their errors from the fit:
00114   TMatrixDSym errMatrix(2);
00115   errMatrix(0,0) = _nsigErr * _nsigErr + expectedNsigErr * expectedNsigErr;
00116   errMatrix(1,1) = _asymErr * _asymErr + expectedAsymErr * expectedAsymErr;
00117   errMatrix(1,0) = _errNsigAsym;
00118   errMatrix(0,1) = _errNsigAsym;
00119 
00120   // Invert the matrix:
00121   double det;
00122   TMatrixDSym invErrMatrix = errMatrix;
00123   invErrMatrix.InvertFast(&det);
00124 
00125   // Put the differences between the expected and measured nsig and
00126   // asymmetry into a vector:
00127   TMatrixD nsigAsymVector(2,1);
00128   nsigAsymVector(0,0) = _nsig - expectedNsig();
00129   nsigAsymVector(1,0) = _asym - expectedAsym();
00130 
00131   // Calculate the chi^2. We copy the invErrMatrix so as not to change it:
00132   TMatrixDSym chi2Matrix = 
00133     TMatrixDSym(invErrMatrix).SimilarityT(nsigAsymVector);
00134 
00135   assert(chi2Matrix.GetNoElements()==1);
00136   double result = chi2Matrix(0,0) / 2;   // divide by 2 for NLL
00137 
00138   if (verbose().Contains("v")) {
00139     cout << GetName() << ": errMatrix = ";
00140     errMatrix.Print();
00141     cout << "  invErrMatrix = ";
00142     invErrMatrix.Print();
00143     cout << " diffVector = ";
00144     nsigAsymVector.Print();
00145     cout << " value=" << result 
00146          << " for ";
00147     printParams(cout);
00148   }
00149   return result;
00150 }
00151 
00152 //------------------------------------------
00153 double BdkOnResNLLYields::expectedNsigP() const {
00154   BdkDKDalitz * pdfP = 
00155     (BdkDKDalitz *)(_pdf->sigGoodD0P().getDalitzPdf()->getPdf());
00156 
00157   return _noCPNsig * pdfP->normOverNoCP();
00158 }
00159 
00160 //------------------------------------------
00161 double BdkOnResNLLYields::expectedNsigN() const {
00162   BdkDKDalitz * pdfN = 
00163     (BdkDKDalitz *)(_pdf->sigGoodD0N().getDalitzPdf()->getPdf());
00164 
00165   return _noCPNsig * pdfN->normOverNoCP();
00166 }

00168 //------------------------------------------
00169 TObject* BdkOnResNLLYields::clone(const char* newname) const {
00170   return new BdkOnResNLLYields(*this);
00171 }
00172 
00173 
00174 //------------------------------------------
00175 // The expected total yield:
00176 double BdkOnResNLLYields::expectedNsig() const {
00177   return expectedNsigN() + expectedNsigP();
00178 }
00179 
00180 //------------------------------------------
00181 // The expected total yield:
00182 double BdkOnResNLLYields::expectedAsym() const {
00183   return (expectedNsigN() - expectedNsigP()) / expectedNsig();
00184 }
00185 
00186 //------------------------------------------
00187 void BdkOnResNLLYields::printToStream(ostream& os, 
00188                                       PrintOption opt,
00189                                       TString indent) const {
00190   
00191   os << "BdkOnResNLLYields " << GetName() << ":" << endl
00192      << "  errNsigAsym=\t" << errNsigAsym() << endl
00193      << "  noCPNsig=\t" << noCPNsig() << endl
00194      << "  noCPNsigRelErr=\t" << noCPNsigRelErr() << endl
00195      << "  nsig=\t" << nsig() << endl
00196      << "  asym=\t" << asym() << endl
00197      << "  nsigErr=\t" << nsigErr() << endl
00198      << "  asymErr=\t" << asymErr() << endl
00199      << "  expectedNsigP=\t" << expectedNsigP() << endl
00200      << "  expectedNsigN=\t" << expectedNsigN() << endl  
00201      << "  expectedNsig=\t" << expectedNsig() << endl
00202      << "  expectedAsym=\t" << expectedAsym() << endl
00203      << "  getVal=\t" << getVal() << endl;
00204   printParams(os);
00205 }

00207 //------------------------------------------
00208 void BdkOnResNLLYields::printParams(ostream& os) const {
00209 
00210   TIterator* iter = _cpProxies.createIterator();
00211   while (RooAbsReal* r = (RooAbsReal*)iter->Next()) {
00212     os << r->GetName() << "=" << r->getVal() << endl;
00213   }
00214   delete iter;
00215 }
